content.description: Climbing becomes steeper the further up the climb you go. Numerous pockets are present throughout the climb.
content.protection: Protected by 5 bolts. Anchor with chains and rap rings
content.location: The first bolted route on the right side of the secret cleft. It is located about 30 feet up the cleft.

content.description: This is an open book climb that includes an easy roof. Holds can be found among the moss and dirt at the base of the route.
content.location: The climb begins just to the right of a madrone tree at the very end of the secret cleft on the left side. A top rope can be set up by walking to the top where there is a bolted anchor.

content.description: A short but sweet climb. A slight overhang adds to the difficulty, but large holds makes the climb easier. The bolts are spaced out when the climbing is easy.
content.protection: Protected by 3 bolts. Anchor with chains and rap rings
content.location: The climb begins way in the back right of the secret cleft. It is the further back of the two bolted routes.

content.description: Climbs outside arete on left side of the Secret Cleft. Between the third and fourth bolt there is an easy scramble to large ledge accessing the upper arete. Climbing becomes more sustained near the the top were the most difficult moves are.
content.protection: 8 bolts. Anchor with chains and rap rings
content.location: On the East Side of the South Comb, there is a steep gully with climbs on both sides. This is the secret cleft, and Edge of Fear follows the arete on the ridge on the East Side. The climb begins at the base of a tree just before you would begin the scramble to the top of the comb.

content.description: A large crack leads up to the top of the secret cleft. Follow the crack towards the top, where it ends. Continue up the wall to the top.
content.location: The crack begins in the back left of the secret cleft. You can set up a toprope by walking through the cleft and then walking along a narrowish catwalk to the top of the cleft. The bolt anchor is the last one.

content.description: Follow a small crack to the top of the wall
content.location: Route begins way in the back left of the secret cleft. You can walk to the top of the wall to set up a Top Rope

content.description: On the East Side of the South Comb, a narrow and steep canyon allows climbers to scramble to the top of the South Comb. This narrow slot is called the Secret Cleft, and the East Side contains a variety of easy climbs. Several of the routes can be top accessed by walking to the end of the cleft, and walking past Raptor Bluff to the top of the East Side.
